question.questionText: Ron covered his notebook with waxed paper. Then he placed a small drop of water in the middle of the notebook as shown in the picture. Even though the drop was on a slope, the drop stayed where he placed it. Describe 2 ways Ron can make the water move down the notebook without pushing the drop or blowing on it.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Expand the drop. Tilt the notebook.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Make it a bigger it might be too small and not have enough power to go down.

Tipping the wax paper.

Or Ron could make his notebook on a steeper slope to make the drop go down his notebook.

Ron could also put a drop of water close by the first drop so that the 2 drops could connect and form a bigger drop, so that the drop would flow down the slope, but do not put the drop of water on the first drop of water.
